meanings.definition: A person who lowers or degrades others.
meanings.sent1: The abasers in the group always made fun of others.
meanings.sent2: She felt hurt by the abasers who constantly criticized her work.
meanings.sent3: The abasers at the party were always teasing people in a playful way.
meanings.sent4: The abasers in the office were like dark clouds, casting negativity everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The abasers were like shadows, always ready to bring others down.

meanings.definition: To lower or degrade someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He would abasers his opponents by spreading false rumors.
meanings.sent2: The bullies abasers the new student by calling him names.
meanings.sent3: She decided to abasers the cake by adding too much salt as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The rain seemed to abasers the once vibrant colors of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The harsh words abasers his confidence like a hammer on glass.
